sentences_texts: I have definately found my new favorite place for dinner and with its large bar for hanging out on the weekends. aspect: dinner
The Scene Though plenty of white-washed tables and chairs are scattered about the dining room, it's the bar that acts as a neighborhood gathering place. aspect: dining room
Worth the trip over the bridge, worth the search for parking, worth the wait for a table at dinner time and worthy of a ten rating. aspect: dinner
Manager couldn't be bothered to come over and acknowledge the mistake. aspect: Manager
The restaurant is attractively decorated but totally lacks an atmosphere partly because of the extra bright lighting. aspect: lighting
i went in one day asking for a table for a group and was greeted by a very rude hostess. aspect: table
Try the shrimp and bacon hash with a perfectly spicy bloody or two, what a brunch should be. aspect: shrimp and bacon hash

Our waitress couldn't tell us what was in the seafood special, forgot to put in our oyster order so it came at the same time as the main meals, wasn't able to provide a confident recommendation from the menu, and had to be flagged several times for drinks. aspect: menu
It is far more popular as a bar than as a restaurant, with only a few tables and the waiter being the bartender, but we greatly enjoyed the unobtrusive atmosphere. aspect: tables
Called to complain and the response was well, we didn't charge you for the falafel sandwich we shorted you. aspect: falafel sandwich
The price is well worth the quality and quantity of food. aspect: price
As a chef I really appreciated the well executed dishes that were full of crisp and vibrant flavor contrast acting in harmony and perfect balance. aspect: chef

This place has great ribs, not to mention hot waitresses, its a great place to meet for drinks and dinner before you go out, but it does turn into a bit of a sausage fest on the weekends. aspect: drinks
Our party of 4 ordered only appetizers (about 6 of them) and made a wonderful meal out of it. aspect: meal
The steaks are just as good, with an assortment of tasty side dishes that make Peter Luger's menu look like the slip in a fortune cookie. aspect: side dishes
For entree I would recommand the rabbit curry - the meat was cooked very finely and the curry sauce, though a bit too sweet, went well with rice. aspect: entree
We sat soaked in red wine for 20 minutes eating our meals w/o the wine b/c the server saw us like that but did nothing until we stopped him. aspect: meals
The food is pretty good, but the staff would rather be anywhere than waiting tables at Maison. aspect: staff

We made a reservation for 5:30pm (20 people) and people were still arriving at 5:45 (over half the group was there) when the manager came over and literally yelled at us for not being on time saying it was a busy time for him, when in fact there were several empty tables throughout the restaurant. aspect: manager
For appetizers, wine, dinner, desert, great convesation, expect to spend a couple of hours. aspect: desert
Most of the staff are friendly but if you're unlucky enough to be served by the waitress that isn't, then the experience can be rather unpleasant. aspect: waitress
I use to always get the turkey club, until recently where I have gotten more bread than turkey. aspect: bread
The food is pretty good, but the staff would rather be anywhere than waiting tables at Maison. aspect: waiting tables

Me and my wife we go there at least once a month, the food they give you is amazing we only get one order of pasta and main course it is enough for both to share,we get full and satisfied, our favorite dish penne with pesto. aspect: pesto
The place is huge, but it's always packed with people waiting to be seated because they made the mistake of not making a reservation! aspect: reservation
Atmosphere, I'd give to Rosa or Maya, but Mexican fare at Zarela is tops. aspect: Mexican fare
we love th pink pony. aspect: pink pony

Service wasn't great - they accidentally gave us our neighbors' entrees, and there was a good 40-minute wait between appetizers and main courses - but the food was overall very good, particularly the desserts. aspect: desserts
Other guests enjoyed pizza, santa fe chopped salad and fish and chips. aspect: fish and chips
The menu features American bistro dishes like crab cakes, chicken under a brick, fresh oysters and various seafood dishes. aspect: seafood dishes
The servers, casual in their striped button-downs, anticipate and fulfill needs as if they were trained as mind readers. aspect: striped button-downs
True, the ambiance is something out of Goodfellas, but it the food and waiters are out of this world! aspect: ambiance
I went back to telly's because i heard that they changed the Chef and the food was again, after a very very small break, was excellent again. aspect: food
The Scene At this sleek spot on a relatively sparse stretch of Spring Street, regulars belly up to a small bar and greet owner Giorgio DeLuca, of Dean and DeLuca fame, with warm hugs. aspect: Scene

The momos (dumplings) are tiny with paper-thin dough, the shitake pancakes are to die for, the steamed greens (I forgot the name of the dish) is delicious as a vegetarian entry or with sauteed salmon. aspect: momos (dumplings)
The green hair table and seating at the front window was tacky and gimmicky, but figured it's the food that counts. aspect: food

THE SERVICE- we had a reservation, they took forever to seat us and when they did we didn't see a waiter for about 15 minutes and he acted as if we were at some drive thru, rushing us and then ignoring our table (actually we hardly saw him at all) throughout the night. aspect: seat
it took forever for the waiter to take my order as he was too busy chatting at the bar. aspect: waiter
The guy was pleasant and friendly but that only goes so far when you are hungry and have to wait 2 hours for a pizza. aspect: pizza
The food did come out quickly and was good, but not worth the prices or the wait. aspect: food

The waitress really struggled with anything more complicated than that--not sure if it was a language problem or what, but 3 of the 4 drinks we ordered came both late and wrong, including beer brought in place of a cocktail, the wrong wine, and a mystery drink that nobody had ordered. aspect: waitress

Me and my wife we go there at least once a month, the food they give you is amazing we only get one order of pasta and main course it is enough for both to share,we get full and satisfied, our favorite dish penne with pesto. aspect: food
Even with reservation, it might take up to one hour to get a table and the staff might not even say a word about it. aspect: reservation
I mean no disrespect to the owner, just constructive criticism - improve the decor and dine-in service, but DON'T change the portions or the recipes. aspect: portions
The lox is always fresh too. aspect: lox
The food arrived 20 minutes after I called, cold and soggy. aspect: food

i was at opia january 5, 2006 we had some drinks, dinner, i have to say that we had me and my friend great time, the staff was listening, the manager knew what he was doing and the food better than ever!! aspect: drinks

The staff is very kind and well trained, they're fast, they are always prompt to jump behind the bar and fix drinks, they know details of every item in the menu and make excelent recomendations. aspect: staff
Had to constantly ask the waiter to top up water glasses, but generally service was ok. aspect: water glasses
I liked the hummos platter, the brie sandwich, and about 20 other things on the menu (if they still have the chocolate cake you need to get it). aspect: chocolate cake
junk food place that could do well with a good cleaning. aspect: cleaning

First, the waiter brought us to a table where people were still finishing their coffee from their meal - he told them the restaurant was busy and they needed to finish now and to pay their bill inside. aspect: waiter

I went there for lunch on a quiet weekday afternoon and everything my friend and I ordered was immaculately presented and absolutely delicious-- I had moules frites and she had the salmon burger. aspect: weekday
The pork was good but 3 small medalians and 2 tablespoons of mashed potatos does not make a meal. aspect: pork
I have been to Casimir over 5 times and I have always had a great time there. aspect: Casimir
The desserts are just as good as all the coffee shops around town but they charge more than anyone. aspect: coffee
Once we ordered, it took at least 30 minutes to get our food, with our server no where in site. aspect: server
While getting a reservation upstairs can be a pain, stopping by on Saturday night for a dinner by the window is a fun way to experience Babbo without the long term planning. aspect: the window
The waiter was able to answer any questions I had about the wine or food. aspect: wine
I cannot imagine a friendlier staff working in a restaurant. aspect: staff

Beyond the green awning and floor-to-ceiling windows, sophisticated (and often European) patrons drink wine from the bar in back and dine on French fare like nicoise salad, foie gras, and steak tartare at tightly packed tables. aspect: bar
There's also a weekend brunch, big on poached eggs, omelets and bagels and lox, plus fresh-squeezed OJ. aspect: omelets
The food is incredibly tasting and, if you want an advice: Grill calamari, Rigatoni a la vodka and, for dessert, Tartufata. aspect: Rigatoni
After a couple of drinks, the apps--I like the lobster/mango summer roll and the cripsy squid--go down great. aspect: drinks
Great food, good size menu, great service and an unpretensious setting. aspect: menu
Good food, but bad service. aspect: food
Authentic Taiwanese food that's cheap... what more could you ask for? aspect: Taiwanese food
A popular diner in the Metro Tch Brooklyn area catering to local brooklyn ites or the wall street financial back office employees of Metrotech. aspect: diner
The kitchen nails pasta dishes, including spicy linguine with clams and pancetta and perfect gnocchi. aspect: linguine with clams
I lived next door and loved to go down for a drink at their uplit marble bar under the beautiful lighting or sit by the fireplace when the live band is not playing. aspect: bar
After I had complained to a bouncer (the manager would not see me) a waiter was sent over and did get us our drinks. aspect: manager
I excused myself from my table went downstairs to inform the hostess that I would like to suprise my dinner guest by recognizing his birthday in a very understated way. aspect: dinner
Going to Bark is always worth the train ride, and will make your tongue and belly very happy! aspect: Bark
There's even a nice menu of savory items served during late lunch and dinner hours. aspect: savory items served

Superfine is my preferred destination in the city when I'm looking for a casual, hip atmosphere, extraordinary food at decent prices and/or just a place to get a good drink, chat with the bartender and shoot some (free) pool. aspect: atmosphere

Went for lunch the bartenders were great, also they had a DJ playing music during the day, there was a Huge screen tv playing music videos and a bunch of other tvs with all the sports you could look at. aspect: bartenders

A couple of hints: 1) avoid going during peak lunch and dinner hours - everything is made fresh so it takes time, 2) definitely try their Concrete desert - my favorite is chocolate with bananas and hot fudge mixed in. aspect: bananas
When they brought out the food the waiter dropped one of the plates right in front of us and didn't appologize or bring us out a complimentry plate. aspect: waiter
I liked the hummos platter, the brie sandwich, and about 20 other things on the menu (if they still have the chocolate cake you need to get it). aspect: hummos platter
Oh yeah, the food's just alright for the price. aspect: food
But it's the ambience that is the draw for me---sipping red wine and sitting under the red awning on a warm night. aspect: red wine
When you go, you should ask for help from the wait staff in deciding what to order since the menu can be daunting. aspect: menu
I have no idea what the food is like here, I only come for the frozen margaritas which I find to be the best I've found in the city and the grilled corn. aspect: frozen margaritas
The wait staff is very attentive, and you can smoke at the bar while enjoying the view of the river. aspect: wait staff
Then, the waitress gave my wife coffee with regular milk in it even though my wife specifically requested Soy Milk. aspect: Soy Milk

The food is on the good side but not so terrific to compensate the bad service, crammed tiny-tables, dirty glasses, overly loud music, which is good for the bar part of the establishment but not when you want to seat down, eat and have a normal conversation at normal volume. aspect: service
We are a huge fan of their brunch - specifically the blt with a fried egg and avocado and their asparagus omelette with truffle oil. aspect: fried egg and avocado
This is by far my favorite place in the neighborhood. aspect: place
Don't they teach their staff how to pour water or wine? aspect: staff
delicious simple food in nice outdoor atmosphere. aspect: food
waitstaff was more into pushing the sparkling water than give me a wine menu. aspect: waitstaff
For dessert, the oversized bread pudding can't be beat. aspect: dessert
The reservation was easy enough to make the night before for a Saturday night (after the pre-theater crowd). aspect: crowd
the pad se ew chicken was delicious, however the pad thai was far too oily. aspect: pad thai
worth every penny, and with the deals on the bar , you could drink and sing to CURRYoke all night,,,, aspect: bar
As for their pasta, the tomato sauce, not the tomato basil; it's got a tang I didn't like. aspect: pasta
Good place for groups of four or large parties but it is not a cozy/intimate setting for 2 although the jazz helps! aspect: place
It's one of our take-out staples because of the good food, fast delivery time and the cheap price (for under $25 we have a dinner for 2 and with left-overs). aspect: delivery
They seem under staffed and Waiters do not really know the menu. aspect: menu

Everything on the menu is satisfyingly savory, from a simple pot of mussels in a choice of sauces (beer-and-bacon, creamy mushroom, or white-wine-and-garlic broth), to beef stewed with beer and prunes, to a juicy croque-monsieur, and beyond. aspect: beef stewed
Nice Family owned traditional restaurant. aspect: restaurant
We waited in standing at the entrance for 5 mins to get seats due to just slow service, another 10mins to get menu, and then another 10mins to get water bread. aspect: menu
A cool bar with great food, and tons of excellent beer. aspect: bar

I went here for a fun dinner with friends - they do not take reservations during the week, but we were seated pretty swiftly for a Friday night, having had a delicious glass of Spanish wine at the bar. aspect: dinner
The staff beginning with the tall gentleman at the door, waiters, etc. aspect: gentleman
And the waiter actually replied, yes that's why it took you so long to get a reservation. aspect: reservation
I could not get a reservation on the phone and when I arrived they would not seat us even though they were half empty. aspect: seat
Don't forget to order a raspberry lemonade or your brunch will not be complete! aspect: raspberry lemonade
The place is full of flavor and color and the music just puts you in the mood for food and drinks. aspect: flavor

Highlights include a breaded veal chop with tomatoes and arugula, a pea-and-mushroom risotto topped with slivers of fried zucchini and doused with truffle oil, and a top-shelf roasted chicken with rapini and sausage. aspect: breaded veal chop with tomatoes and arugula
The food is definitely the attraction, but the service has been consistently bad on every visit. aspect: food
The staff offers impeccable service. aspect: staff
The menu is divided up into several sections, and most of the dishes are smallish plates, like tapas. aspect: dishes
The waitress at the bar was very nasty to me because she mistakenly took an order for thai ice tea from me when I asked for thai lemonade in a to-go cup. aspect: thai lemonade

The not-so-friendly-cigarette-reeking waiter asked if we had any questions then when we did ask, he rolled his eyes and covered his face with the menu to say something to a passing coworker. aspect: menu
Getting into the steak frites takes some sawing, but once cut, the meat is flavorful, if in need of salt. aspect: steak frites

The menu features such sumptuous fare as lobster ravioli in a light aurora sauce, double-cut grilled veal chop with an aromatic salsa verde, and octopus salad with steamed potato, red onions, and caper berries. aspect: menu
After I had complained to a bouncer (the manager would not see me) a waiter was sent over and did get us our drinks. aspect: waiter
Further, our waiter was basically inattentive through the entire dinner (e. aspect: waiter

Staples are available every which way--tacos hard and soft, wrapped in tortillas stuffed with guacamole, cheese or black beans; burritos of beef, breaded catfish, pork pipian and chipotle chicken; plus a choice of four sauces from mild to just plain stupid. aspect: chipotle chicken
We had to wait 30 minutes before the waiter even came to our table and had to ask 4 times just to get a glass of water. aspect: glass of water

We had to ask FIFTEEN TIMES for water, we had no idea what we were eating (due to incomprehensible serving staff), waited 25 minutes after asking for our bill, and were charged a 20% corking fee ON WINE WE BOUGHT THERE. aspect: serving staff
went there for dinner over the weekend and was treated rudely right away by what I think was a manager who was doing anything but managing. aspect: manager
Food is okay for the price, however there is definitely better thai restaurants!! aspect: price

Remember the 80's when you have to wait 1-2 hours for a table even though you have a reservation + the wait staff treated you like the idiot that you are for paying $2-300 per head for this treatment, then you should definately come to experience this jewel!! aspect: wait staff
I liked the hummos platter, the brie sandwich, and about 20 other things on the menu (if they still have the chocolate cake you need to get it). aspect: brie sandwich
The place is huge, but it's always packed with people waiting to be seated because they made the mistake of not making a reservation! aspect: place
Good atmosphere, the service is so-so and there is a long wait if you don't have reservations. aspect: atmosphere
The Food The key element to a proper British chip is fat, and the flabby, pale yellow specimens here come close to the ideal. aspect: Food

The dinner menu looks like it has a more interesting selection of entrees, but if they are even the fraction of the quality of the items we ate for lunch, I whole-heartedly advise you to make it a point and dine at Creama--if not for the drinks, then definitely for the unique approach to mexican. aspect: quality
Worth the trip over the bridge, worth the search for parking, worth the wait for a table at dinner time and worthy of a ten rating. aspect: table
An otherwise fine meal was trashed when i realized that the dish i had ordered contained chicked, despite my asking for no chicken, no pork twice. aspect: dish

The organic free range chicken was a 6, the lamb chop was excellent, and we had to send the halibut back 2x with no result- ended up having to order anther dish (cod) in which the fish was good but the clams were too tough to eat and the sausage wasn't even finished cooking (thus could not be consumed). aspect: lamb chop
Frustrated, hand the check back to the server and said 'by the way, never got the dessert and he said i did not realize you wanted dessert' aspect: server
atmosphere is not that relaxing, if you go - you MUST bring a cell phone and go down the street for a drink. aspect: atmosphere
The menu features American bistro dishes like crab cakes, chicken under a brick, fresh oysters and various seafood dishes. aspect: crab cakes
Our waiter recommended thZt we share a few of the appetizers; they were great. aspect: appetizers

As we looked at the menu and the wine list, my friend overheard the manager comment to a waitress about me that the least he could do is wear a button down shirt, and not show up dressed like a Gristede's boxcutter. aspect: manager
the decor isn't quite like Shun Lee but the service will definitely make up for any shortcoming. aspect: service

We went out on the town with the idea that we were going to mingle with the in crowd, you know, go to a place where you pay an outrageous cover charge, have to wear all black to fit in, and pay $12 for a watered-down martini, and if you're lucky, have a good time. aspect: time
cirspy crust margherita pizza aspect: margherita pizza
My boyfriend and I loved Imagine Bar and Grill. aspect: Grill
The wine the service was very good too. aspect: service
Oh, the prices were not so bad either, we paid $58 for chicken, salmon, one sushi roll, one ceasar salad and soda :). aspect: salmon
Noodle pudding is exactly the type of service and food I enjoy. aspect: food
Other guests enjoyed pizza, santa fe chopped salad and fish and chips. aspect: santa fe chopped salad

After the grilled calamari, we got onion soup that had no soup, a dish of beans that had no flavor, the kitchen didn't make one of the three pasta dishes ordered, and the pork chop and other main dishes were not very good. aspect: pork chop
We are laidback diners and as we've both waited tables, we tend to be forgiving of irregular service. aspect: diners
Our waiter never once came by the table to ask us how our meal was. aspect: table
There's also a weekend brunch, big on poached eggs, omelets and bagels and lox, plus fresh-squeezed OJ. aspect: bagels
No one bothered to ask if we were enjoying our food or whether or not we wanted more to drink (we apparently needed to be out by 8). aspect: drink
I have never been so disgusted by both food an service. aspect: food
My only complaint was the ginger iced tea was too sugary - but the home-made fresh lemonade was very tasty and fresh. aspect: ginger iced tea
However, the appetizers I've tried (rolls, calamari, fish fingers) were really delicious. aspect: calamari
It is a must for lunch,dinner or anytime you have a big appetite and don't want to spend big bucks in the big Apple! aspect: dinner

An unfriendly hostess greeted us and placed us in the main room of the restaurant where the tables were so close together that it was impossible for guests and waiter to move without bumping you. aspect: hostess
You may as well just extend the bar into the restaurant since it has already penetrated it with loud music, loud voices, and a remarkable amount of cigarette smoke. aspect: music
Best drumsticks over rice and sour spicy soup in town! aspect: drumsticks over rice

In Short It's a bakery, takeout place and cafe all in one, and thanks to dishes prepared using the same ingredients stocked at famed gourmet food emporium, Zabar's, prices and quality are upscale. aspect: dishes

This place happens to be beatifully designed, the atmosphere is relaxed (as opposed to the noisy community dining atmosphere in so many busy chinese reataurants - which can also be OK) the food is authentic Chinese as opposed to what they think Americans would like, the staff is friendly and unhurried. aspect: staff
Our lovely waiter sent us off with scones for breakfast the following AM! aspect: breakfast

They kept the chef, margarita machines, and practically the identical menu from Miracle Grill (the restaurant that formerly had the space); how is it that everything here is so much worse? aspect: space
The food at Cafe Asean is to die for, and the prices are unmatchable. aspect: prices
Same quality for 1/3 the price and a realistic atmosphere. aspect: price
We love the food, drinks, and atmosphere! aspect: drinks
My friend also knew the chef, so we had some other courses not on the menu, but even knowing the chef didn't get us the service I would expect at this type of restaurant. aspect: service
The Scene  Chief among the neighborhood's bustling cafes is Kolonaki, with its inviting upstairs space, replete with rich, dark wood tables and windowsills. aspect: Scene
For appetizers, I'd recommend the soft shell crab, spicy New Zealand mussels, calamari and anything from the sushi bar. aspect: soft shell crab
The kinds of places like this where strangers are likely to share a table during the lunch rush always have better food than the Table-cloth places. aspect: lunch
If you want to go there only go for drinks and the atmosphere b/c the food is definitly not worth it!! aspect: drinks

The waitress really struggled with anything more complicated than that--not sure if it was a language problem or what, but 3 of the 4 drinks we ordered came both late and wrong, including beer brought in place of a cocktail, the wrong wine, and a mystery drink that nobody had ordered. aspect: cocktail
The waiter had a slight attitude and brought our wine aprroximately 10 minutes into our appetizer. aspect: attitude
The presentation was clever, and the food tasty however the service that accompanied it was so slow it made us feel neglected. aspect: service

After the grilled calamari, we got onion soup that had no soup, a dish of beans that had no flavor, the kitchen didn't make one of the three pasta dishes ordered, and the pork chop and other main dishes were not very good. aspect: flavor
Our party of 4 ordered only appetizers (about 6 of them) and made a wonderful meal out of it. aspect: appetizers

Staples are available every which way--tacos hard and soft, wrapped in tortillas stuffed with guacamole, cheese or black beans; burritos of beef, breaded catfish, pork pipian and chipotle chicken; plus a choice of four sauces from mild to just plain stupid. aspect: stupid
Thalia is a beautiful restaurant with beautiful people serving you, but the food doesn't quite match up. aspect: Thalia

The Food While there are plenty of meat dishes, including the sweet and spicy Curry Ga with humongous slices of chicken mixed with eggplant, onions and coconut milk, and Bo Sate with sauteed beef, pineapple and crushed peanuts, seafood and vegetarian dishes make up most of the menu. aspect: onions and coconut milk
I lived next door and loved to go down for a drink at their uplit marble bar under the beautiful lighting or sit by the fireplace when the live band is not playing. aspect: live band
When the bill finally arrived, the head waiter sternly told us that this time is okay, but next time you have to order more than 2 appitizers and a main course! aspect: waiter
One of the managers offered us a seat at the bar to wait for a table, there we had the most amazing empanadas and red sangria. aspect: wait
but we waiting two hours to get it (we had reservations but it was late so we wanted to try to come in earlier). aspect: waiting
The numbness in your lower legs from sitting on old wood chairs is more than compensated by the wonderful food. aspect: food
When I went for sunday brunch, not only was the food bland and cold, they didn't even bother to clear the plates once they brought the bill. aspect: brunch
I found the food to be outstanding, particulary the salmon dish I had. aspect: salmon dish
after booking reservations at Danube, only to show up and not have any tables available, the Danube somelier graciously called over to Bouley and got us a table for immediate seating. aspect: tables
Had an after-work drink at the bar with a date, loved the place so much we came back for brunch the next morning. aspect: brunch
I heard the lobster roll was excellent. aspect: lobster roll
The whole fish was excellent--not overcooked and served in a light tomato broth. aspect: served
One of the managers offered us a seat at the bar to wait for a table, there we had the most amazing empanadas and red sangria. aspect: sangria
As for their pasta, the tomato sauce, not the tomato basil; it's got a tang I didn't like. aspect: the tomato sauce
The server (Jasmine) checked up on us periodically and was patient as she explained certain menu items. aspect: server

Most diners stick to hot (shredded chicken breast in garlic and walnut sauce) and cold (briny tapenade, made with Greek olives, capers and anchovies) meze, served in handsome vintage dishes. aspect: dishes

Service wasn't great - they accidentally gave us our neighbors' entrees, and there was a good 40-minute wait between appetizers and main courses - but the food was overall very good, particularly the desserts. aspect: food
Our waitress' visits to our table were few and far between. aspect: table
When the manager was asked for things did imporve but 2 hours to get our meal. aspect: manager

Staples are available every which way--tacos hard and soft, wrapped in tortillas stuffed with guacamole, cheese or black beans; burritos of beef, breaded catfish, pork pipian and chipotle chicken; plus a choice of four sauces from mild to just plain stupid. aspect: tortillas stuffed with guacamole
My date and I were both taken back by the lack of the friendly attitude from the owner of the restaurant. aspect: owner
The drinks were water down and the only BIG thing was the bill. aspect: bill

It wasn't until we spoke with management that we were able to finish our meal and get out of the restaurant, but already one of our party had to leave early and the rest of us were late for our afternoon engagements. aspect: engagements
The food took forever to come out from the kitchen. aspect: food
For appetizers we ordered Chicken Samosas and Lasooni Gobi and for main course we ordered Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Pasanda and Saag Paneer they were all just scrumptious. aspect: appetizers
Went to Butter on Monday night for a friend's birthday dinner at like 11:00pm, the kitchen was supposedly closed, but we spoke to the manager and we were seated promptly. aspect: manager
The waitress was friendly but did not know the menu and had to run to the kitchen after each question. aspect: menu
I have been to Roth's twice and both times were very disappointing. aspect: Roth's
Our waitress recommended the coffee flan for dessert, and we didn't regret it. aspect: waitress
The kitchen nails pasta dishes, including spicy linguine with clams and pancetta and perfect gnocchi. aspect: gnocchi
Call it a bar with weak but tasty sangria and leave it at that. aspect: sangria
The menu features American bistro dishes like crab cakes, chicken under a brick, fresh oysters and various seafood dishes. aspect: chicken
) And don't forget the svc, those waiters stare at you your entire meal, just waiting for you to put your fork down and they snatch the plate away in a second. aspect: waiting

In Short Though it's more of a takeout and delivery operation than a sit-down restaurant, Risotteria does offer eight small tables for those who want to savor their risotto hot off the stove. aspect: risotto
Sashimi was ok (maki rolls tasted better). aspect: Sashimi
It's not going to win any awards for its decor, but the food is good, the portions are big, and the prices are low. aspect: prices
I have been here a few times and never had a boring meal!Food always fresh, service very civilized. aspect: Food
We had a nice bottle of wine, dinner, and dessert for under $200. aspect: bottle of wine

Our waiter (who also seemed to be the manager) dropped red wine all over me the contents of my purse and all he did was apologize quickly, hand me some club soda and avoid me for the rest of the time I was there. aspect: waiter
Come to people watch and drink, but stay away from the food and service. aspect: drink
Also available is eggplant in garlic sauce, the Zen vegi-burger, with sunflower seeds, kale and brown rice, and curry-rice-noodle soup. aspect: eggplant in garlic sauce
There were sesame seeds on the outside (it's pizza dough not a hamburger bun), barely any sauce, VERY thin slices of mozzarella sparingly applied and topped with lots of herbs. aspect: sesame
For dinner we decided to share on the Veal Cordon Blue (wow) and the Artic char, a nice dish. aspect: dish
The place is full of flavor and color and the music just puts you in the mood for food and drinks. aspect: place

There were a few moments during the tasting menu that left me speechless, such as the shrimp in cream sauce, toro with foam, foie gras custard, eggplant in miso and a foie gras kobe beef filet fried ball that brought me to tears. aspect: moments
I'm from Italy and i felt home great and fresh food ,good pizza,i been there few times and i always go with the special or seafood, about dessert try the profitterol. aspect: dessert
The waitress encouraged to come for dinner and brunch, and I followed her recommandation. aspect: brunch
I got an excellent piece of cheesecake and we had several other nice pastries. aspect: pastries
We had a nice bottle of wine, dinner, and dessert for under $200. aspect: dinner
the hostess wasn't sure until 3 hours later 10:28: Here we go Eggplant parmigiana fried grease an heavy duty Pollo dish covered with 1/4 of a pound of mozzarella. aspect: dish
I've been here twice for brunch, and I found the ambience and food to be much better than the overly-hyped Kitchenette next door. aspect: ambience

I love the decor but would not recommend sitting in the communal tables unless its a very big group, much more fun getting a table and people watch while you chomp on your $20 palm sized truffle pizza. aspect: sized truffle pizza

This place happens to be beatifully designed, the atmosphere is relaxed (as opposed to the noisy community dining atmosphere in so many busy chinese reataurants - which can also be OK) the food is authentic Chinese as opposed to what they think Americans would like, the staff is friendly and unhurried. aspect: community dining atmosphere
The food was average: the almond crusted halibut was bland, while the sashimi appetizer was excellent. aspect: almond crusted halibut

Everything on the menu is satisfyingly savory, from a simple pot of mussels in a choice of sauces (beer-and-bacon, creamy mushroom, or white-wine-and-garlic broth), to beef stewed with beer and prunes, to a juicy croque-monsieur, and beyond. aspect: menu
While I love this place, I do recommend going here mostly for lunch or an early dinner because the crowd and long wait can be annoying. aspect: place
For appetizers, wine, dinner, desert, great convesation, expect to spend a couple of hours. aspect: convesation
The burritos are so great, I crave them while I am sitting at my desk and dreaming about lunch. aspect: lunch
I prefer to sit in the lounge area or at the bar, as the service is quicker and the space is more attractive. aspect: space
Yes, this place is good, a cut above some of the other local diner food and a nice, friendly atmosphere. aspect: place

In Short It's a bakery, takeout place and cafe all in one, and thanks to dishes prepared using the same ingredients stocked at famed gourmet food emporium, Zabar's, prices and quality are upscale. aspect: prices

Remember the 80's when you have to wait 1-2 hours for a table even though you have a reservation + the wait staff treated you like the idiot that you are for paying $2-300 per head for this treatment, then you should definately come to experience this jewel!! aspect: table

i was at opia january 5, 2006 we had some drinks, dinner, i have to say that we had me and my friend great time, the staff was listening, the manager knew what he was doing and the food better than ever!! aspect: dinner

With tacky kitsch as the decor's dominant motif and the obligatory grousing waiters hustling out brick-sized steaks and icy vodka to gussied-up regulars and tourists, an evening at Sammy's is both dinner and street theater. aspect: waiters
Last night was our second time dining here and we are still amazed with the food. aspect: dining
Then the waitress became upset when she returned with the drinks and we didn't stop our conversations quick enough to remind her who had ordered what only 5 minutes prior. aspect: drinks
Saul is the best restaurant on Smith Street and in Brooklyn. aspect: Saul
The appetizers were delicious and the entrees were superb (the mahi was a little bland, but I guess you can't win them all). aspect: appetizers
For $65, you will get a 5-6 course tasting menu encompassing a variety of raw fish, cooked fish, pastas, dessert, etc. aspect: pastas
I asked the waiter to move us to another table because we didn't want to rush our meal. aspect: waiter
The menu features American bistro dishes like crab cakes, chicken under a brick, fresh oysters and various seafood dishes. aspect: menu
You have to be comfortable eating with your hands, sharing the same plate with your friends and be able to handle spicy food (not as spicy as some thai dishes though). aspect: thai dishes
The food is incredibly tasting and, if you want an advice: Grill calamari, Rigatoni a la vodka and, for dessert, Tartufata. aspect: Grill calamari
However, the appetizers I've tried (rolls, calamari, fish fingers) were really delicious. aspect: fish
Dinner is a tad dodgy, especially if you don't eat meat or fish. aspect: Dinner
I had to ask the waiter a couple of times to clear our empty glasses. aspect: waiter
The owner Don greeted us at the door with a warm smile, and seated us for dinner upstairs. aspect: dinner
Friendly staff that actually lets you enjoy your meal and the company you're with. aspect: staff
The Scene Uncomplicated, tasteful touches--a soothing abstract painting, an exposed brick wall, a tiny bar--grace the restaurant's neutral-toned interior. aspect: Scene
Went to Butter on Monday night for a friend's birthday dinner at like 11:00pm, the kitchen was supposedly closed, but we spoke to the manager and we were seated promptly. aspect: kitchen
The menu features American bistro dishes like crab cakes, chicken under a brick, fresh oysters and various seafood dishes. aspect: American bistro dishes

after booking reservations at Danube, only to show up and not have any tables available, the Danube somelier graciously called over to Bouley and got us a table for immediate seating. aspect: reservations
I went on a Saturday night on the recommendation of the new General Manager, Mike who also did Cheetah Club and Le Souk. aspect: Club
The sake menu should not be overlooked! aspect: sake menu

95 all-you-can-eat lunch is tooted as a good deal but a the ambiance is dreadful and you can get a terrific meal, also kosher vegetarian, in peace with service just around the corner for $2 more. aspect: meal
We waited in standing at the entrance for 5 mins to get seats due to just slow service, another 10mins to get menu, and then another 10mins to get water bread. aspect: bread
The food was of a relatively high standard, except the oysters seemed a little off. aspect: food
I have no idea what the food is like here, I only come for the frozen margaritas which I find to be the best I've found in the city and the grilled corn. aspect: grilled corn

The organic free range chicken was a 6, the lamb chop was excellent, and we had to send the halibut back 2x with no result- ended up having to order anther dish (cod) in which the fish was good but the clams were too tough to eat and the sausage wasn't even finished cooking (thus could not be consumed). aspect: sausage
What a great place! aspect: place

as for the people whom posted about the salad, I never had it, as for the person that had no sides with the steak, they must have made a mistake, everytime I go its come's with awesome potatoes. aspect: steak

The waitress really struggled with anything more complicated than that--not sure if it was a language problem or what, but 3 of the 4 drinks we ordered came both late and wrong, including beer brought in place of a cocktail, the wrong wine, and a mystery drink that nobody had ordered. aspect: beer
For $65, you will get a 5-6 course tasting menu encompassing a variety of raw fish, cooked fish, pastas, dessert, etc. aspect: dessert

Staff would not change a meal to accomadidate food allegeries. aspect: Staff

95 all-you-can-eat lunch is tooted as a good deal but a the ambiance is dreadful and you can get a terrific meal, also kosher vegetarian, in peace with service just around the corner for $2 more. aspect: vegetarian

The pizza is thet always fresh and just made they hav an outdoor seating area that is partially covered they also have a full service restaurant on the premises they make everything on premises. aspect: outdoor seating area
waitstaff was more into pushing the sparkling water than give me a wine menu. aspect: wine menu

we ordered simple salads, which were outrageous in price and def. aspect: price

With tacky kitsch as the decor's dominant motif and the obligatory grousing waiters hustling out brick-sized steaks and icy vodka to gussied-up regulars and tourists, an evening at Sammy's is both dinner and street theater. aspect: dinner

worth every penny, and with the deals on the bar , you could drink and sing to CURRYoke all night,,,, aspect: penny

waitstaff was more into pushing the sparkling water than give me a wine menu. aspect: water

my one complaint is that when we were finished with our dinner, it took an abnormally long time for our waitress to get with the program and bring us our check. aspect: waitress

A word to the wise: you can't dine here and disturb the maitre-D's sense of " table turnover", as whacked as it is, or else. aspect: maitre-D
I don't even think I would have minded waiting at the bar for over an hour if it weren't so crowded and if they had little tapas for the hungry people forced to wait! aspect: bar
When we went to dinner here, the place was empty, which should have been a clue. aspect: dinner
When the manager came to our table at the end of the meal and asked how our experience was, I complained to him about the cold. aspect: cold
We politely asked our server for the regular menu, but were told that for large parties they could only offer us the banquet menu (would have gone elsewhere had we known). aspect: banquet menu
When we got our bill the drinks were full priced and when we asked, our waitress said that there is no happy hour on the roof. aspect: waitress
It is always hard to find a seat and the selection is not that great but it is one of the few places to get lunch for only a buck. aspect: seat

– I loved the pumpkin ravioli and the goat cheese gnocchi (5 big ones to a plate instead of 20 or so little gnocchis) and my sister loved her filet mignon on top of spinach and mashed potatoes. aspect: pumpkin ravioli

THe back garden sitting area is very pleasant, where you can see their personal herb garden. aspect: back garden sitting area
Management should really take notice and train their waitstaff and teach them some proper manners. aspect: Management

What really makes it shine is the food, which is aggressively seasoned with Cyrpriot spices, and all made in-house (even the gyro meat and sausages), and made of much higher quality ingredients that might otherwise be expected. aspect: sausages
I highly recommend Cafe St. Bart's for their food, the ambience and wonderful service. aspect: service
Pair you food with the excellent beers on tap or their well priced wine list. aspect: priced wine list
Over all it was a very nice romantic place . aspect: place

Snack on a bowl of fried chickpeas while you browse the menu, then move onto the tender lamb skewers, which arrive atop a slab of French bread, perfectly poised to catch the meat's sweet drippings. aspect: menu

Our waiter brought out three main courses, but the fourth wasn't ready so we had to wait for 10 minutes for the last dish to arrive, but they were very nice and gave us free red pepper hummus while we waited. aspect: dish
The service was non-existant, the manager spent all of his time at the bar. aspect: bar

The space was so fantastic that once we heard they were serving dinner we decided to go one night and try it out. aspect: space
The staff there is very attentive and down to earth. aspect: staff

While the staff was kind and attentive, our waiter never once broke a smile, even when I told him it was my friend's birthday, although he did bring a dessert with a candle at the end of the meal. aspect: dessert
Food wise, its ok but a bit pricey for what you get considering the restaurant isn't a fancy place. aspect: Food
Candles on the tables, cozy furnishings and music at just the right level make it a great dining experience. aspect: Candles

If you like your music blasted and the system isnt that great and if you want to pay at least 100 dollar bottle minimun then you'll love it here. aspect: bottle minimun

The defining characteristic of this popular restaurant, aside from dirt-cheap hot dogs, is the beverage selection, which includes a light and refreshing papaya juice, an extremely sweet pineapple juice and a sweet and frothy pina colada drink. aspect: drink

Food was just average...if they lowered the prices just a bit, it would be a bigger draw. aspect: Food

to be honest we only had drinks and appetizers downstairs as we were there for a collegues leaving drinks but the staff was very friendly (typical aussies) and the food i did have was pretty darn good. aspect: food

Server made several sake suggestions which were very good. aspect: Server

dinner on 1st floor (street level) a bit noisy, 2nd floor has bed-style seating that is good for dessert drinks (do not attempt to have entree on the bed, what a mess it will be trying to eat rice dishes with sauce while half-lying down). aspect: rice dishes

I love the food here, and although it is pricey, the entree comes with rice, naan, dal, and salad, which makes it worthwhile. aspect: dal
Cute place, nice wait staff but would never go there again. aspect: place

There's another girl who I can't describe, she is about 5'6" with brown hair, who eavesdrops on your conversation and chimes in - except she only hears the last part of what you said, so her uninvited opinions are often out of context and nothing to do with what you're *really* talking about. aspect: girl
